==Social, legal and psychological views on necrophilia==
==Social, legal and psychological views on necrophilia==

===Cause and prevalence===
+
--[[User:88.105.185.45|88.105.185.45]] 22:25, 9 February 2007 (UTC)--[[User:88.105.185.45|88.105.185.45]] 22:25, 9 February 2007 (UTC)===Cause and prevalence===
â
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalence of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown<ref name="klaf">Klaf, Franklin S., and Brown, William (1958). "Necrophilia: Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652. "Inhibited forms of necrophilia and necrophilic fantasies may occur more commonly then is generally realized."</ref> (1958) commented that, although rarely described, necrophilic fantasies may occur more often than is generally supposed.
+
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalence of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown<ref name="klaf">Klaf, Franklin S., and Brown, William (1958). "Necrophilia: BEN TUKER IS A NECROPHILIA Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652. "Inhibited forms of necrophilia and necrophilic fantasies may occur more commonly then is generally realized."</ref> (1958) commented that, although rarely described, necrophilic fantasies may occur more often than is generally supposed.
Rosman and Resnick<ref name="rosman">Rosman, Jonathan P., and Resnick, Phillip J. (1989). [http://www.burknet.com/robsfantasy/section11a.html "Sexual attraction to corpses: a psychiatric review of necrophilia,"] ''Bulletin of the American Academy of Psychiatry and the Law'', 17, 153-163.</ref> (1989) theorized that either of the following situations could be antecedents to necrophilia (pp. 161):
